content.raw: looks like the client timed out waiting for server to come up.  Is this a intermittent error or is the failure consistent?
content.html: looks like the client timed out waiting for server to come up. Is this a intermittent error or is the failure consistent?

content.raw:
I haven't tried to reproduce it, but Jenkins is [not having that problem](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-drcsim_1.0-devel-precise-amd64/1/testReport/?).  The `drcsim` tests include a [test](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/5a3eb819d344b8618810d969400c7a4554e0163b/ros/drc_robot_utils/test/drc_robot_publishers_hz.test?at=drcsim_1.0) that launches `drc_robot.launch` and verifies that data is being published via ROS.

What happens if you try launching on a local machine?
content.html:
I haven't tried to reproduce it, but Jenkins is not having that problem. The drcsim tests include a test that launches drc_robot.launch and verifies that data is being published via ROS.

What happens if you try launching on a local machine?

content.raw:
I reinstalled the drcsim and gazebo package on my local machine and it works if I use localhost as the ROS_IP (although the error is not the same) .... 

Next: checking for networking problems on a new cloud instance.
content.html:
I reinstalled the drcsim and gazebo package on my local machine and it works if I use localhost as the ROS_IP (although the error is not the same) ....

Next: checking for networking problems on a new cloud instance.

content.raw: It wasn't reproducible, either on a local machine or a newly launched cloud machine.  It might have been due to a transient network/hostname problem.  In addition, we've stopped launching `gzclient` on the cloud machines, which should have the effect of reducing the chance of this happening again (assuming that the error was coming from `gzclient` failing to contact the master).
content.html: It wasn't reproducible, either on a local machine or a newly launched cloud machine. It might have been due to a transient network/hostname problem. In addition, we've stopped launching gzclient on the cloud machines, which should have the effect of reducing the chance of this happening again (assuming that the error was coming from gzclient failing to contact the master).

content.raw: Other users are reporting this same problem.  Details to be added.
content.html: Other users are reporting this same problem. Details to be added.

content.raw: The `_DummyThread` error messages are a [known issue](https://code.ros.org/trac/ros/ticket/3950) in rospy caused by an [underlying problem](http://bugs.python.org/issue14308) in Python.  They can be ignored.
content.html: The _DummyThread error messages are a known issue in rospy caused by an underlying problem in Python. They can be ignored.

content.raw:
The real problem here is evidenced by these two lines:

    Error [Transport.cc:102] Unable to get topic namespaces in [50] tries.
    Error [Node.cc:72] No namespace found

A Gazebo node is failing to talk to the Gazebo master.  Anybody who's having this problem: is it 100% reproducible?  What happens if you launch without the GUI, which you do like so:

    roslaunch drc_robot_utils drc_robot.launch gzname:=gzserver

If that starts up successfully, you can then start the GUI client separately:

    gzclient
content.html:
The real problem here is evidenced by these two lines:

Error [Transport.cc:102] Unable to get topic namespaces in [50] tries.
Error [Node.cc:72] No namespace found

A Gazebo node is failing to talk to the Gazebo master. Anybody who's having this problem: is it 100% reproducible? What happens if you launch without the GUI, which you do like so:

roslaunch drc_robot_utils drc_robot.launch gzname:=gzserver

If that starts up successfully, you can then start the GUI client separately:

gzclient

content.raw:
Hmm, then there's this error:

    X Error of failed request:  BadDrawable (invalid Pixmap or Window parameter)
      Major opcode of failed request:  136 (DRI2)
      Minor opcode of failed request:  3 (DRI2CreateDrawable)
      Resource id in failed request:  0x3e00002
      Serial number of failed request:  28
      Current serial number in output stream:  30

So perhaps the server died because of an X rendering issue and as a result the GUI client couldn't talk to the master (which is in the server process).

Is your GPU driver configuration working properly?  What does `glxinfo` say?
content.html:
Hmm, then there's this error:

X Error of failed request:  BadDrawable (invalid Pixmap or Window parameter)
  Major opcode of failed request:  136 (DRI2)
  Minor opcode of failed request:  3 (DRI2CreateDrawable)
  Resource id in failed request:  0x3e00002
  Serial number of failed request:  28
  Current serial number in output stream:  30

So perhaps the server died because of an X rendering issue and as a result the GUI client couldn't talk to the master (which is in the server process).

Is your GPU driver configuration working properly? What does glxinfo say?

content.raw: Assuming that the underlying problem is GPU configuration.  Re-open if there's something Gazebo-specific.
content.html: Assuming that the underlying problem is GPU configuration. Re-open if there's something Gazebo-specific.
